body_content.explanation: to say or think that something is the result or work of something or someone different to the thing or person previously believed to have caused or done it:
examples: Patients on the insomnia program learn to reattribute the cause of their sleeplessness.
Although it was originally thought that the picture was painted by him, it has now been reattributed to one of his contemporaries.
The doctors were taught how to re-attribute physical complaints to psychological problems.
